intro: Cacalia scorpioides var. sororia, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue petals and prominent yellow central disk. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The variety 'sororia' is distinguished by its slightly smaller flowers and more compact growth habit compared to other varieties.
